Krazyguy75 (24 upvotes): 'awful, 12 MC investment for TR every 3 turns, needs Venus at 6% which requires 3 gens passed.' benbever: 'doesn't see much play, very slow, microbes only to Venus cards.' Venus 6% requirement означает 3 WGT шага или ты сам push Venus. Самостоятельно 1 TR за 3 gen — при 6-7 gen remaining максимум 2 TR. С Extreme-Cold Fungus: 1 TR/gen = отличный combo, но требует 2 конкретные карты. Microbes restricted to Venus cards — только 10 targets в колоде 400+. Venus + Microbe теги — ценны для Ecologist, но карта слишком медленная и requirement-зависимая.
Thermophiles.when_to_pick: Только с external microbe source (Extreme-Cold Fungus, Symbiotic Fungus) + Venus уже at 6%+. Без combo — trap карта.

Underground City.name: Underground City
Underground City.economy: Стоимость 18+3=21 MC (steel-payable) + 2 energy-prod (19.4 MC) = 40.4 MC effective. Ценность: city VP (~2 VP ≈ 3.2-16 MC) + 2 steel-prod (18.2 MC) = 21.4-34.2 MC. Дефицит 6-19 MC. Late-game: energy-prod worthless = effective 21 MC за city + 2 steel-prod.
Underground City.reasoning: Объективно одна из худших city-карт. shai_aus: 'least-favourite city card, why does it cost 2 energy?' yolopukki567 (26 upvotes): 'never understood why -2 energy prod.' marekt14: 'compare to Noctis City — same price, only -1 energy, +3 MC-prod.' Noctis строго лучше. the_propaganda_panda: 'awful but not so bad late game as discounted SP city.' -2 energy-prod = ~19.4 MC effective penalty. 2 steel-prod = 18.2 MC return. City VP = 1-3 VP placement-dependent. Effective cost: 18+3+19.4-18.2=22.2 MC за city + VP — хуже SP City (25 MC но без energy loss). ad_hocNC: 'terrible city, played underground marginally more than corporate for end game points.' Единственный плюс: steel-payable + Building/City теги.
Underground City.when_to_pick: Last 1-2 gen с excess energy-prod + steel для оплаты. Как замена SP City если energy-prod не нужен. Не берём ради production.

Jet Stream Microscrappers.name: Jet Stream Microscrappers
Jet Stream Microscrappers.economy: 12 MC + 3 MC card = 15 MC. Action: 1 titanium (~3 MC) for 2 floaters, OR spend 2 floaters for 1 Venus TR (~7 MC). 2 actions + 3 MC per Venus TR = slow and expensive.
Jet Stream Microscrappers.reasoning: Classic floater trap. Requires 2 full actions (add floaters, then spend them) for 1 Venus TR, plus titanium cost. Over 8 gens starting gen 1: maybe 3-4 Venus TR for 15 + 12 MC in titanium = 27 MC. That's ~7 MC per Venus TR which is technically ok but the action cost is devastating. Venus track is the least important parameter. Most experienced players instant-pass this.
Jet Stream Microscrappers.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only for Hoverlord milestone or if you have free floater placement. Floater trap card.

Aquifer Pumping.name: Aquifer Pumping
Aquifer Pumping.economy: 18+3=21 MC upfront + 8 MC/ocean (in steel). 1st ocean: 29 MC. 2nd: 18.5/each. 3rd: 15/each. Need 3-4 oceans to approach fair value. In 3P only ~3 oceans per player.
Aquifer Pumping.reasoning: Mathematically bad in 3P/WGT. The first ocean costs 29 MC, and you need 3+ oceans to break even with standard project pricing. In 3P with ~3 oceans per player, you rarely get more than 2-3 uses. Only playable with Mining Guild or IC with massive steel surplus. The steel-payable action is the only redeeming quality. Mostly a trap card. [CORRECTED: 35/D -> 45/D. Desktop D, worse than standard project]
Aquifer Pumping.when_to_pick: Only with Mining Guild and no other ocean options, or IC with 20+ surplus steel.

Dust Seals.name: Dust Seals
Dust Seals.economy: 2 MC + 3 MC card = 5 MC cost. Returns: 1 VP (~5 MC late game). No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Max 3 oceans requirement limits to gen 1-2.
Dust Seals.reasoning: One of the worst cards in the game. 5 MC for 1 VP is fair math, but buying VP in gen 1-2 is terrible strategy. The max 3 oceans requirement makes it a dead card most of the game. No tags means zero synergy value. Per benbever, only worth playing if received as a free card, with Vitor (+3 MC back), or for Sagitta (+4 MC). Occasionally helps Tactician on Hellas. [CORRECTED: 35/D -> 38/D. Desktop D, terrible VP per MC]
Dust Seals.when_to_pick: Almost never draft this. Only play if received for free or if specific synergies make it cheap enough.

Ice Cap Melting.name: Ice Cap Melting
Ice Cap Melting.economy: Стоимость 5+3=8 MC. Ценность при розыгрыше: 1 ocean + 1 TR = ~20 MC. Profit: +12 MC. Проблема: playable ~5% games. Expected value: 0.05 × 12 + 0.95 × (-3 wasted draft pick) = -2.25 MC. Terrible EV для draft pick.
Ice Cap Melting.reasoning: Потрясающий value когда работает, но работает крайне редко. Krazyguy75: 'terrible, 95% games last ocean placed before this playable, says Gain 1MC 19 out of 20 games.' shai_aus: 'cheapest ocean in the game, that's not bad if you can play it.' ad_hocNC: 'can be vital when rushing with lots of heat.' Req +2°C значит temp почти maxed, а к этому времени 9 океанов обычно уже размещены. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Когда playable: 8 MC (5+3) за ocean + TR = фантастическая сделка (~20 MC value). Но спекулятивный draft ранних gen = держишь мёртвую карту. С Inventrix (-2 req) чуть лучше. Поднимаю с D35 до D37 — ceiling достаточно высок чтобы оправдать редкие wins.
Ice Cap Melting.when_to_pick: Только mid-late game если +2°C уже достигнут и океаны остались. Никогда не берём в gen 1-3 draft спекулятивно.

Orbital Reflectors.name: Orbital Reflectors
Orbital Reflectors.economy: Стоимость 26+3=29 MC (ti-payable). Ценность gen 1: 2 Venus TR (14.2 MC) + 2 heat-prod (9.12 MC) + Venus+Space теги (4-5 MC) = 27.3-28.3 MC. Barely break-even. Gen 3+: heat-prod = ~6 MC, total = 24 MC → deficit.
Orbital Reflectors.reasoning: Антисинергетический дизайн — Venus push (engine) + heat-prod (rush). shai_aus: 'absolute garbage.' marekt14 (8 upvotes): 'pushing Venus + heat gen = jack of all trades, outscaled by pure engine AND pure rush. F tier honestly.' benbever: value fair на бумаге (32 MC value vs 29 MC cost) но 'this combination is probably not what you need.' Ti-payable через Space тег — единственный плюс. Venus TR не продвигает конец игры, heat-prod без other heat sources медленный. warpspeed100: 'no great reason to raise Venus track.' ad_hocNC: 'raising track = disaster if you unlock someone's Venusian Animals.' Понижаю до F32 — карта проигрывает обоим стратегиям которые пытается поддержать.
Orbital Reflectors.when_to_pick: Только Aphrodite/UNMI + ti-payment + Venus milestone/award в игре. В остальных случаях — одна из худших карт.

Venus Magnetizer.name: Venus Magnetizer
Venus Magnetizer.economy: Стоимость 7+3=10 MC. Action: -1 energy-prod (9.7 MC) → +1 Venus TR (7.1 MC) = -2.6 MC per use. С Robinson: -1 energy-prod + gain 1 MC → effective cost 4 MC per TR = excellent. 2 uses = 2 TR (14.2 MC) за 10 + 2×9.7 = 29.4 MC → break-even if late game energy worthless.
Venus Magnetizer.reasoning: Нишевая Venus action-карта. shai_aus: 'slightly more useful than Equatorial Magnetizer, still not playing it.' Krazyguy75: 'why do so many Venus step cards require Venus terraformed?!' Req Venus 10% = Venus уже 5 шагов, большинство Venus payoff карт req 12-18%, так что Venus Magnetizer мало что разблокирует. Action: -1 energy-prod → +1 Venus TR = 9.7 MC → 7.1 MC = убыток, если energy-prod не excess. warpspeed100: 'need inexpensive energy prod cards already, so many other cards looking to use energy.' Однако: Venus тег дёшево (10 MC total), с Robinson Industries стоимость = 4 MC за TR, с excess energy (Energy Saving, Mass Converter) = decent late game. Futuralis: 'never more than 2 uses.' Чуть лучше Orbital Reflectors из-за дешевизны.
Venus Magnetizer.when_to_pick: С Robinson Industries или excess energy-prod late-game. Venus тег для Venuphile award. Не берём без конкретной синергии.

Asteroid Hollowing.name: Asteroid Hollowing
Asteroid Hollowing.economy: 16+3=19 MC upfront + 1 ti (~3 MC)/action for 1 MC-prod + 1/2 VP. Over 5 gens: spend 15 ti = 45 MC total. Gain 15 MC-prod return + 2.5 VP (12.5 MC). Massive loss.
Asteroid Hollowing.reasoning: One of the worst cards in the game, as COTD unanimously agrees. 19 MC upfront plus titanium per action for slow MC-production and 1/2 VP per asteroid is terrible ROI. The titanium is worth more spent on actual space cards. Even with Astrodrill synergy, the base card is too expensive and too slow. Classic trap card. [CORRECTED: 30/F -> 42/D. Desktop D]
Asteroid Hollowing.when_to_pick: Never. Even with Astrodrill, there are better uses for your titanium.

Aerial Lenses.name: Aerial Lenses
Aerial Lenses.economy: Стоимость 2+3=5 MC. Ценность: 2 heat-prod (9.12 MC) - 1 VP (8 MC late) + remove 2 plants (~2 MC in 3P adjusted) = 3.12 MC. Дефицит ~2 MC. Kelvinists ruling bonus: +2 MC per ruling = ~2-4 MC за игру. Total: barely break-even.
Aerial Lenses.reasoning: Одна из абсолютно худших карт в игре. shai_aus: 'this is terrible, right?' Krazyguy75: 'another Kelvinists card, negative VP and no tags, this card sucks.' Krazyguy75 добавляет: 'could just pay 10 and get better version from Kelvinist power, only 5 more expensive = value of 1VP, unlimited uses.' -1 VP = ~8 MC late penalty. No tags = -3 to -5 MC. Kelvinists ruling req непредсказуем. 2 heat-prod (9.12 MC) за 5 MC effective выглядит ок, но -1 VP (8 MC) убивает экономику. Effective: 5 MC за 2 heat-prod - 1 VP = 9.12 - 8 = 1.12 MC value. Plant removal в 3P = take-that penalty. warpspeed100: 'not strictly unplayable but really unimpactful.' Оставляю на F.
Aerial Lenses.when_to_pick: Практически никогда. Даже с Kelvinists ruling — Kelvinist policy лучше. Не берём.

Underground Detonations.name: Underground Detonations
Underground Detonations.economy: 6+3=9 MC for action: spend 10 MC for 2 heat-prod (8 MC). Net loss 2 MC per activation. Building tag ~1-2 MC. One of the worst cards in the game.
Underground Detonations.reasoning: shai_aus's legendary roast says it all - use cases include 'bonfire fuel' and 'bank robbery calling card.' Spending 10 MC for 2 heat-prod (worth 8 MC) is negative value every activation. The Building tag for Builder milestone is literally the only use case. Universally considered one of the worst cards. [CORRECTED: 15/F -> 38/D. Desktop D, one of worst cards]
Underground Detonations.when_to_pick: Never. If you play this card voluntarily, something has gone terribly wrong.
